segments.text: I notice how the light streams in, filling the kitchen with warmth and making everything appear so inviting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the reality inside feels anything but inviting with that water overflowing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so engrossed in her dish that she’s missed the brewing storm at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost funny how she’s daintily polishing that plate while chaos surrounds her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see the boy stretching for the cookie jar, his little face almost euphoric.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But it scares me to watch him on that flimsy stool, ready to topple over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is filled with anticipation, her hand reaching out like she’s about to get a treasure.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Each moment feels like it could be the tipping point for something disastrous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish the woman would just look up and see the mess; it’s almost heartbreaking to witness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stillness of the garden outside only amplifies the sense of impending chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR
